ygData.subject: RE: Question on EQ etiquette (OT and long)
ygData.msgSnippet: I totally agree.  I d only leave before all CR s were done if those who still had corpses specifically said they were not hanging around to retrieve their
ygData.messageBody:
I totally agree. I'd only leave before all CR's were done if those who
still had corpses specifically said they were not hanging around to retrieve
their corpses right away.

Heck, I've done CR's for people nearly twice my level with great risk just
to help them out. It's really sad to see people behave that way.

Kitasi

-----Original Message-----
From: James Schuldes [mailto:jgs@...]
Sent: Tuesday, December 28, 1999 2:33 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Question on EQ etiquette (OT and long)


From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>

I would say that was total crap thing to do. If the guy was guilded, I'd be
writing to his guild leader. If you got a server email list or a server web
BBS (Playervault, whatever) I'd be posting there. That's a total crap
situation.

This whole story is a prime example of how being in a guild can make life so
much better. Having guild members in the group can make a world of
difference. And having high level guild members can make really hard CR
much easier (wolf form is non-agro to most stuff in Unrest) and you don't
need to worry about consenting a guild member to drag you out.

But guilded or not - I would not have left until everyone was CR'd.

Sylly Songsynger
Bard of the 40th song
somewhere on Innoruuk



-----Original Message-----
From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
Sent: Tuesday, December 28, 1999 2:36 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Question on EQ etiquette (OT and long)

From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>

Had a bad situation last night in the ghost room in Unrest. Want to run it
by everyone to get your opinion.

[snips scene of ugly death]

I was bound in GFAY. Before I could finish memming my songs, the group
leader (the shaman) said he had to leave so he could complete one of the
shaman armor quests.

Was wondering what the general consensus is with you guys on the shaman's
behavior. In every group I have been in so far everyone stuck around until
everyone got their corpse back, especially the group leader. I was totally
appalled by the shaman's behavior. This was far and away the maddest I have
been since I have been playing. It was also the first time I have ever
gotten into a /tell argument with someone over any issue. Anyone who has
ever grouped with me can tell you that I can get along with just about
anybody. This guy pushed me beyond my limits though. Was I out of line for
expecting the group leader to stick around?

Galtin of E'ci

Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
